title: Technical SEO - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Mike Arnesen October 28, 2014 Semantic Analytics: How to Track Performance and ROI of Structured Data Technical SEO | SEO Analytics | Advanced SEO Mike Arnesen shares how to use Google Tag Manager to track the ROI of your site's structured data. Plus, learn how to leverage your markup to produce "semantic analytics." Read this post By: Lewis Sellers September 23, 2014 Setting Up Magento for the Search Engines Technical SEO | SEO Basics | E-Commerce SEO Looking to optimize your Magento site for search? It's easier than you think and well worth the effort. With a few simple adjustments, your site could be a favorite of search engines and web searchers. Read this post By: Nick Sayers September 10, 2014 School's in Session at Moz Academy Technical SEO | Moz Tools | SEO Basics Enjoy a ton of terrific instructors at Moz Academy for free, and in the process soak up so much SEO knowledge that you'll be able to spread the love and teach others! Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard September 8, 2014 The Big List of SEO Tips and Tricks for Using HTTPS on Your Website Technical SEO | Advanced SEO It’s rare when Google reveals any of its actual ranking factors, so it came as a big surprise when representatives announced they would reward sites using HTTPS encryption with a boost in search results. HTTPS isn’t like other ranking factors. Implementing it requires complexity, risks, and costs. Webmasters balance this out with benefits that include increased security, better referral data, and a possible boost in rankings. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard August 12, 2014 We Removed a Major Website from Google Search, for Science! Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO What happens when you accidentally de-index your site from Google, on purpose? We decided to find out for ourselves by removing Followerwonk from search results. Here's what we learned. Read this post By: Tudor Bastea July 21, 2014 Reinclude Your Content in Google in Less Than 4 Hours Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO Yikes! We accidentally deindexed our site. Here's how we got it back in Google's index within a few hours. Read this post By: Mark Traphagen July 9, 2014 Author Photos are Gone: Does Google Authorship Still Have Value? Technical SEO | Advanced SEO Does Google Authorship still matter once photos no longer show up in SERPs? Mark Traphagen considers why they were removed and what's next for Authorship. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard June 26, 2014 Google Announces the End of Author Photos in Search: What You Should Know Technical SEO | Search Engines Many of us have been constantly advising webmasters to connect their content writers with Google authorship, and it came as a shock when John Mueller announced Google will soon drop authorship photos from regular search results. Let's examine what this means. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard June 17, 2014 Feeding the Hummingbird: Structured Markup Isn't the Only Way to Talk to Google On-page SEO | Technical SEO | Advanced SEO Many SEOs limit their understanding of entity search to vague concepts of structured data, Schema.org and Freebase. They fall into the trap of thinking that the only way to participate in the entity SEO revolution is to markup your HTML with complex schema.org microdata. Let's explore why this isn't true. Read this post By: Tom Anthony June 16, 2014 IPv6, C-Blocks, and How They Affect SEO Technical SEO | Advanced SEO You have probably heard about IPv6, but you might remain a bit confused about the details of what it is, how it works, and what it means for the future of the Internet. This post gives a quick introduction to IPv6, and discusses possible SEO implications that could follow from IPv6 being rolled out (touching specifically on the concept of C-Blocks). Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard May 28, 2014 Take the SEO Expert Quiz and Rule the Internet Technical SEO | Advanced SEO | SEO Basics You are master of the keyword. You create 1,000 links with a single tweet. Google engineers ask for your approval before updating their algorithm. You, my friend, are an SEO Expert. Prove it by taking our new SEO Expert Quiz. Read this post By: Carla Dawson April 1, 2014 Parallax Scrolling Websites and SEO - A Collection of Solutions and Examples Technical SEO I have observed that there are many articles that say parallax scrolling is not ideal for search engines. Parallax Scrolling is a design technique and it is ideal for search engines if you know how to apply it. I have collected a list of great tutorials and real SEO-friendly parallax websites to help the community learn how to use both techniques together. Read this post By: Bill Hartzer March 17, 2014 An SEO's Guide to Acquiring New gTLDs Technical SEO In this SEO's guide to the new gTLDs, I'm going to introduce you to the new gTLDs, tell you (from an SEO perspective) what you need to know, and what you can do to acquire them. Read this post By: Kristina Kledzik March 3, 2014 Mobile Site Audit Checklist Technical SEO Now that it's 2014, the question isn't "should I build a mobile site?" It's "how do I build a good mobile site?" So, behold, a checklist! Read this post
